item.title: Re-Understanding Pearson Correlation Coefficient
item.description: Everyone seems to know correlation but they do not. At least I didn’t. To understand correlation, we need to first understand covariance. As the name suggests, covariance measures the extent to which two variables covary, i.e., vary together. But the questions are: what does “vary” mean, and how do we quantify “together”? For example, I give you these two vectors: import matplotlib.pyplot as plt a = [2, 4, 6, 8] b = [1, 2, 3, 8] Can you tell me the extent to which they “vary together”?
